titleStmt.title: The dignity of kingship asserted: in answer to Mr. Milton's Ready and easie way to establish a free Common-wealth. Proving that kingship is both in it self, and in reference to these nations, farre the most excellent government, and the returning to our former loyalty, or obedience thereto is the only way under God to restore and settle these three once flourishing, now languishing, broken, & almost ruined nations. / By G.S. a lover of loyalty. Humbly dedicated, and presented to his most Excellent Majety Charles the Second, of England; Scotland, France and Ireland, true hereditary king.
titleStmt.author: G. S., Lover of loyalty.

titleStmt.title: The dignity of kingship asserted: in answer to Mr. Milton's Ready and easie way to establish a free Common-wealth. Proving that kingship is both in it self, and in reference to these nations, farre the most excellent government, and the returning to our former loyalty, or obedience thereto is the only way under God to restore and settle these three once flourishing, now languishing, broken, & almost ruined nations. / By G.S. a lover of loyalty. Humbly dedicated, and presented to his most Excellent Majety Charles the Second, of England; Scotland, France and Ireland, true hereditary king.
titleStmt.author: G. S., Lover of loyalty.
Searle, George, attributed name.
Sheldon, Gilbert, 1598-1677, attributed name.
Starkey, George, 1627-1665, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E.C. for H. Seile over against St. Dunstans Church in Fleet-street, and for W. Palmer at the Palm-tree over against Fetter-lane end in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: G.S. = George Searle, Gilbert Sheldon, or George Starkey. William R. Parker in his introduction to the facsimile edition of this work (1942) suggests that Starkey is the most likely of the three to have written the work.
A reply to: Milton, John. The readie and easie way to establish a free commonwealth.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: H. Seile over against St. Dunstans Church
